author: Special Correspondent
text:
“If India is to shine now and in the future, people must have the freedom to decide; and while governments can be in the business of monitoring, they should have no role in telling people what to do,” Ratan Naval Tata, Chairman Emeritus of Tata Sons, said on Monday.

During an interaction with students of SRM University on Monday, Mr. Tata said: “As you go through life, many things you could not find in college, you will find in your profession down the line.”

India did not have a basic health care network and there existed social stigma attached to disability,” Mr. Tata said during the interaction.

“Less attention has been given to disability-oriented vehicles and we do not even have a ramp on many pavements to address the needs of people on wheelchairs,” he said in response to a question from a student.
title: People must have freedom to decide: Ratan Tata
